conclusion: Analyze the problem without applied voltage; the ball falls vertically under gravity.
Analyze the problem with applied voltage; an electric field exerts a horizontal force on the ball.
The horizontal force equals the vertical force because the trajectory makes a 45-degree angle.
Determine the electric field: E = U/d.
Relate the forces: Fe = q(U/d) and Fe = G.
Solve for the charge q: q = G(d/U).
The charge amount of the small ball is Gd/U.
